result.execSummary:
The defendant John L McAdory was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

Good Time Credit granted.
Consecutive to: Case No. 2008CF000258

records.addlTxt: Case Called @ 2:50 PM: Defendant John L McAdory in court with attorney Matthew Loren Goldin.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court enertains waiver of pre-lim hearing in its entirety.  Court accepts knowing and voluntary waiver of pre-lim hearing.  Def BOT.  INFO Filed. Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.    Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Terms of bifurcated SEH explained.  Plea QN reviewed w/Defendant.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Meds/Treatment serving no impairment on proceeding today.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed.  Plea:  NC  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses outright Repeater Enhancer.  Argument by ADA - argues for consecutive probation to ES.  Argument by Atty Goldin - Release date is sometime in 2025 with approx 20 yrs ES.  Argues for Costs only.  Statement by Def:  Yes, apologizes for actions.  The Court:  Court declines to place Def on probation.  6 mos WCJ consecutive to 08CF258 with GT credit application or 4-1/2 mos will be left to serve.  Costs of action imposed from up to 25% of earnings.
Petition and Order for Writ of Habeas Corpus ad Prosequendum
